function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential for incomplete inactivation of the virus due to variability in wettability of the Cu 2 O/PU film","Impact":"Incomplete inactivation could lead to the persistence of live viruses on coated surfaces, increasing the risk of transmission","Mitigation":"Ensure consistent wettability of the Cu 2 O/PU film to guarantee effective viral inactivation","Technologies":"Surface characterization methods, such as XPS and SEM, to monitor and control wettability","People":"Researchers, laboratory staff, and potential users of the coated surfaces","Owner":"Research team, laboratory staff, manufacturers of Cu 2 O/PU coating"},{"Description":"Discrepancies in reported biocidal mechanisms of Cu 2 O compounds for viral inactivation","Impact":"Uncertainty in the virucidal activity of the coating and potential ineffective virus control","Mitigation":"Further research and validation of the biocidal mechanisms of Cu 2 O compounds to ensure consistent and reliable virucidal activity","Technologies":"Biological and chemical testing methods to confirm virucidal activity","People":"Researchers, laboratory staff, manufacturers, and potential users of the coated surfaces","Owner":"Research team, laboratory staff, manufacturers of Cu 2 O/PU coating"},{"Description":"Uncertain virucidal activity against specific viruses, such as SARS-CoV-2","Impact":"Potential for ineffective protection against specific viral strains, including high-consequence pathogens","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough investigations into the virucidal activity of Cu 2 O/PU film against specific viruses, including SARS-CoV-2, and publish findings for public health guidance","Technologies":"Viral infectivity assays, virus culture methods, and genomic sequencing for virus identification","People":"Researchers, laboratory staff, manufacturers, public health officials","Owner":"Research team, laboratory staff, manufacturers of Cu 2 O/PU coating"}]}
